New Records: Argentina became the first South American team to win three consecutive major trophies, matching Spain's feat from 2008-2012.
Lautaro Martinez's winning goal in extra time was his fifth goal of the 2024 Copa America, earning him the Golden Boot.
Emiliano Martinez became the first Argentina goalkeeper to record five clean sheets in a single edition of Copa America.
Lautaro Martinez's winner was only the fourth extra-time goal in the history of Copa America finals.
Leandro Paredes became the first player in the 21st century to make four tackles as a substitute in a Copa America final.
Key Match Events: The Copa America final between Argentina and Colombia was delayed by more than an hour due to chaotic scenes outside the stadium.
Lionel Messi was forced off with an injury in the 66th minute of the final.
Lautaro Martinez scored the winning goal in extra time.
Leandro Paredes made a significant contribution by winning the ball back and starting the move for the winning goal.
Emiliano Martinez kept a clean sheet, making it 33 clean sheets in 45 appearances for Argentina.
Pre-Game Insights: The match was delayed by 82 minutes due to organizational issues and chaotic scenes outside the stadium.
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni praised his team's resilience and ability to overcome difficulties.
Colombia coach Nestor Lorenzo reflected on the impact of the pre-match delay on his team's preparations.
Lionel Scaloni praised Angel Di Maria's performance and his contributions to the team.
Lionel Scaloni commented on Lionel Messi's determination to play through injury.
Davinson Sanchez expressed his disappointment but emphasized Colombia's determination to move forward.
Sergio Aguero praised the Argentina team for their victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in searing heat, which added to the issues faced by fans outside the stadium.
Argentina's victory marked their third consecutive major trophy win, following the 2021 Copa America and the 2022 World Cup.
Argentina conceded only one goal in the entire tournament, becoming the fourth team ever to achieve this in a single edition of Copa America.
